#DraftDodgerInChief https://twitter.com/AP_Politics/status/977357218348785664 QT @AP_Politics BREAKING: President Trump issues order to ban most transgender troops from serving in military except under 'limited circumstances.'

But Donald Trump’s decision tonight would not only prevent qualified servicemembers from protecting this country at a time when we can’t afford to turn anyone away, it also goes against our nation’s values of inclusion and equality. It is blatantly discriminatory.

If someone is brave enough to be willing to put their life on the line for this country and they are capable of doing the job our military needs—regardless of gender identity, sexual orientation or race—we shouldn’t stop them.

When my Blackhawk helicopter was shot down in Iraq, it didn’t matter to me if the troops risking their lives to help save me were gay, straight, transgender or anything else; all that mattered to me was that they were American GIs. https://twitter.com/ap/status/977357984790646784 QT @AP BREAKING: Trump issues order to ban most transgender troops from serving in military except under `limited circumstances.'

This is bigotry, pure and simple. I think the students down in Parkland, Florida have shown us the definition of that persistence. We need to follow through and give as a strong statement as possible, so we can see the laws changed in this country. https://www.facebook.com/RepAdamSmith/videos/2091787034181130/

Well the students from Parkland seem to show us that standing up and speaking out can make a difference. Representative democracy does work. Sometimes it takes an aggravating amount of time, but I will say that you have to be patient and persistent.

We’ve had tragedy after tragedy and many of us who are strong advocates for gun control have become discouraged. To be honest, when you see something like Sandy Hook happening, and no policy change follow, you wonder what is it going to take?

I really want to thank the #ParklandStudents for all the leadership they have shown in the gun control debate. They have moved the needle in the way that really hasn’t happened before. #EnoughisEnough #NeverAgain #StudentsDemandAction

Most of these proposals are bipartisan. And the VAST majority of Americans support them too. But @SpeakerRyan and the @HouseGOP take their orders from the @NRA. It’s time to put people over politics. (8/9)

HR 1612 – Closes the gun show loophole led by @RepMaloney. Where you purchase your firearm should be irrelevant – background checks must be universal. (7/9) http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DZD77g-XcAAleFk.jpg

HR 3999 – Bill to outlaw bump stocks led by @RepCurbelo. Bump stocks turn semi-automatic weapons into already-illegal fully automatic machine guns. The killer in Las Vegas used one to gun down dozens of innocent civilians. They should be outlawed – no question about it. (6/9) http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DZD7w3rWAA0bWV6.jpg
HR 1478 – Repeals the federal ban on gun violence research led by @RepStephMurphy. It’s sad that this is needed but yes, it’s come to this. (5/9) http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DZD7h-3X0AEM_g6.jpg

HR 3464 – Bill requiring completed background checks before buying a gun led by @JimClyburnSC. There’s no good reason you should be able to buy a weapon before your background check is completed. Common sense. (4/9) http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DZD7UAhWkAA34R9.jpg

HR 5087 – Assault Weapons Ban led by @RepCicilline. These weapons are designed to kill as many people as possible. They may have a place on the battlefield, but they have no place on our streets. (3/9) http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DZD7BY9W0AA6Y20.jpg
